sentences.sContent: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
sentences.sCn: 大多数商店要到上午10点才开始营业。

sentences.sContent: She’s not a very nice person.
You were wrong not to inform the police.
sentences.sCn: 你没有通知警方是错误的。

sentences.sContent: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
sentences.sCn: “我们能去公园吗？”“不，今天不行，亲爱的。”

sentences.sContent: ...and in that case you're not lost...
...Some scholars think teamwork may not always be reliable...
...it now turns out that exercise can exhaust not only your muscles...
...Most people do not have clear memories of past events...
...It’s not about that; it’s about growth for me...
...The river basin is not only the birthplace of the ancient Chinese civilization，but also the most prosperous region in the early history of China...
...but that’s not the case for me...

phrases.pCn: vt. 以便不（未到...的程度）

trans.tranOther: used to make a word, statement, or question negative
